title: Projects
text: Here you will find links to some of my currently ongoing projects on GitHub, followed by a listing of past (mostly academic) work with links to retrospective summaries.

title: Projects
text:
In progress

Python implementation of an agent-based model of a minimal market-based economy developed by Steilgitz et al., with various extensions including emissions trading.
Data gathering, analysis, and modelling of carbon market price dynamics.
Simple web app for calculating carbon units earned from forestry in the NZ-ETS.

title: Projects
text:
Past work




  




T-matrix calculations





Development and testing of software for T-matrix calculation of light scattering by assemblies of particles.




 




  




Nanoalloys structure prediction





Global optimisation Algorithm development and application in theoretical structure prediction of mixed metal clusters.




 




  




Gallium superatoms





Superatom analysis of the electronic structure of metalloid gallium clusters.




 




  




Nanoscale capillary action





Molecular dynamics simulation and thermodynamic modelling of capillary absorption of metal nanodroplets.




 




  




Melting of atomic clusters





Molecular dynamics simulation and thermodynamic modelling of metal nanoclusters melting.

title: Dmitri Schebarchov
text:

Welcome to my website!
I am a computational modeller with PhD in physics and extensive postdoctoral experience in simulation-based research, mostly in the realm of nanoscale materials modelling.
After joining a fin-tech startup, my interests broadened to include agent-based modelling of socio-economic systems: markets, emissions trading schemes, and blockchain networks.
To branch out even more, I intend to pursue a number of data science projects and use this website for (i) blogging about my learnings and (ii) showcasing some of my work.
Please, feel free to download my CV, see what skills I have on offer, explore my projects portfolio, read my blog, or reach out by e-mail.
